comments.text: Excellent spot, we walked there, and got a ride in less than 15 min.
Good place for Tel Aviv even at night :)
On a friday afternoon, just before p.transportation cuts off, i crowded  up with about 20 orthodox in this station, and got picked up to Tel Aviv in 30 minutes by a beautifull young lady. Lucky me.

I took a guy to Beer-Sheeva from here after being asked by him. he waited about 45 min.
לקחתי בחור מפה לבאר שבע. הוא פנה אליי לרכב אחרי שחיכה 45 דקות

This is well known hitch spot by hitchhikers and drivers, i have hitch back to tel aviv for 5 times here , the peak of hitching is 5-8 clock,you will hitch with more than 10 local folks .
And you can get ride to tel aviv ,ashdod or even Haifa here if you are patient enough!

During friday you can meet many young jewish people HHing. It wasn t so traffic road despite is the only road to Eilat. I HHed here two times the first i ve waited like an hour with other people and the second time 30 minutes around. The waiting could be tough but at least 86% of cars are going directly to Eilat
the desert ranger picke me up but he said it's illegal to stop there.

Very beautiful spot, and great for a ride to Eilat.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Mitzpe_Ramon

the junction has been changed a bit much since march 2013, the bus stop to the west is not at all placed well for hitch hiking but in all other directions they are well put- behind traffic lights. הצומת השתנתה מאז מרץ 2013 והתחנה לכיוון מערב ממוקמת בצורה ממש לא מותאמת לטרמפים,אבל בכל שאר הכיוונים התחנות ממוקמות טוב, מאחורי רמזורים.

Two backpackers took a ride from here to Haifa in no-wating time. The "Trempiyada" is located after the split, of course.
שני תרמילאים קיבלו טרמפ מפה לחיפה בשתי שניות. הטרמפיאדות ממוקמות על הכביש כמובן, אבל אפשר גם לשאול אנשים בצומת גולני. יופי של מקום לתפוס.

Golani Junction Has four "Trempyadas" (See an article about an official israeli hitchhiking spot) in every direction. North goes up to the "high galil" and the Golan hights, west goes to Haifa, south to Affula and Tel aviv and East to The gallile sea. It's a great spot to find a ride.
Lifted a thumb and got a ride. Everyone here goes in direction of the Golan
Bus stop with plenty of space and good visibility. Got a direct ride to Eilat after a few minutes.
Bus stop with good visibillity and shoulder to stop. Rides to Arrava Junction, Dimona, Dead Sea.

I got a ride in less than 10 minutes. Not that many cars pass through here but when they do, they tend to slow down quite a bit due to the curve. Anyone who is open to picking up hitchhikers will likely stop here.
There's a bus stop here excellent stop for Tel Aviv always huge traffic !!! :)
other direction is fine too.
it was quite easy to get a ride to Mitspe Ramon

This junction is great. The name is Telalim junction. From here you can HH to Mizpe Ramon/Elat or to Beersheva or to Nizzana and Ezuz. I ve HHed here many times in all directions. I have HHed on night too going to Ezuz and is very safe and easy.
Like many kibbutzes, there is a bus stop here where you can hitchhike. The cars slow down here, so it's easy to get a ride to Mitzpe Ramon, and further to Eilat.

Good place to hitch to all directions.
Also, there is a very nice water spring a little bit south west to here, in the fields. It is called Ein Shefa. http://amudanan.co.il/#!wiki=P752140
Great place for swtiching to Eilat-Be'er Sheva-Dead sea. We got a ride to Eilat from the first car.
This is "Ha-Arava junction" going south. There is a bus-hitchhiking spot (Trempiyada) and also a gas station here.
i got a direct ride to Jordanian border junction.
just a short ride but it was nice.
low traffic but the fifth car took me
just ask a tourist to take you back to Masada
the whole area is great for HH. i could make 20 very good sports... i waited max 10 mins.
it was night but the Israelis are generous. to Kfar Sold
to Haifa. there were 2 hh-ers, after them i got a ride.

Best spot for going north and south 
Everyone can stop for you
Got picked up by a marine biologist heading towards Migdal. Great potential spot for Tiberias and onwards, lots of place to stop
Literally a two minute wait to the Migdal commercial area.
Bus stop, shade, plenty of space and slow cars.
Bus stop, shade, plenty of space to stop, good visibility.
Bus stop, shade, plenty of place to stop and good visibility.
Good spot to hitch north if you don't wanna go to the spot further north.
Great spot to hitch towards the crater/south/east. It's after the last roundabout so all cars in that direction pass here. After the end of the pedestrian walk there is enough space for cars to stop.
Big rest area on highway no 6. Got quickly a ride to Haifa.
Bus stop (shade). Good place to get a car towards Beer Sheva or further.
Easy for rides to Mitzpe Ramon or further. Bus stop/shade and water nearby.
Not much traffic. Bus stop with lot's of space for stopping and some sun protection.
Long wide shoulder for cars to stop. Rides direction Arrava Junction or Arad.
Busy junction with lots of traffik. Bus stop with plenty of space to stop.
Great spot for rides to road 90, Dead Sea/Eilat. Cars are slow from the traffick light and can stop at the bus stop.
Getting a ride from here to Kiryat Shmona is very easy, but the otherside not so much
Got a ride from this place to Kiryat Shmona in a few minutes wait.
Took me 10 mins to get a ride back to my destination, great place for riders to stop

I was HH on Sunday after Shabbath. It has took a bit to find a ride most of the cars are full. Many people go to Elat for the week end. The positive thing is that there are many cars which they go to Tel Aviv. I found a ride directly to Telalim junction going to Ezuz and driver continued to Beer Sheva and further toward Tel Aviv
a small stopping bay, north of the roundabout
Best spot going north from Mitzpe Ramon, all traffic passes here. After a roundabout and plenty of space. No shade.

You don't need to walk this far, but it helps if you get bored waiting at the roundabout for a ride north. Good chance of a ride to Tel Aviv or similar place north.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Mitzpe_Ramon
Doesn't exist anymore, a new interchange was built here.

To Jerusalem! a good spot there is a LOT of traffic so it is better to come with a sign.
but there are also "Superbus" busses and "Sheirut" group cabs coming from telaviv that dont cost much and will get you very fast to jerusalem too :)
good luck.
P.S !
make sure you get with the right kind of people - cus there are all sorts of wierdos on the highway.

Getting a ride to TLV area.
OR getting a schedueld ride with
http://www.bgu.co.il/tremp.aspx
you need to get someone to translate for you but they have a lot of rides offered going to Beersheba (south of the country) area.
Good luck!
p.s 
this spot is better with a sign.
for heading east walk a bit on the road, there'll be a bus stop in 200m. got a ride strait to tiberias!
Its a well known spot to grab a ride, and locals gather here for small distance pick ups aswell. Avrage waiting time is about 30 minutes but the distance of travel is variable.

French Hill Junction. It's a good place for hitchhiking to several places. You can hitch from here to the Dead Sea, towards route 90 and then south towards Eilat or north towards Tiberias, Sea of Galilee and the Golan Heights, to Palestinian cities that are north of Jerusalem, to West Bank/Samaria settlements.
Excellent place to get in any direction since the most drivers are longrange, got a ride to Jerusalem in no time. But I suppose there are also a lot of drivers going to Tel Aviv.
There's a good place to stop somewhere here for the Dead Sea much better than the previous one that suckss ass since it's uphill 3 lanes and the cars won't always see you
I got picked up here in the night and got taken to the entrance of the highway which was perfect !!! :D
I hhed here twice booth at night once at 2AM stand under the light and have a sign

A spot for Jerusalem 
Go down onto the highway but be careful only accept rides stright to jerusalem or at least the city before becasue on the highway THERE IS NO PLACE TO STOP !!! :D
dir.: south.
dir.: north. a little bit still in the town, but it wasn't too crowded in january.
Good Place to hitch east direction Mount Meiron and the villages of the Galilee. Bus station.
around 10 am, hitchihiked as 4 people and 2 out of first 2 cars stopped and took us to the main road.
Masada hostel
We got a ride to the dead sea after 15 minutes waiting.
bus stop can be used for hitchhiking in both direction, cars are fast but notice you on a long distance
from the Jordanian border to Taba

Two backpackers took a ride from here to Ramat-gan on Shabbat and we could go until Rishon-Lezion.
שני תרמילאים תפסו מכאן טרמפ לרמת גן תוך רגע ביום שבת. בחור צעיר לקח אותנו ויכולנו גם להגיע לראשון לציון.

A big open shopping center where you can get a ride to Tel-aviv easy. Just stand on the ramp that goes south.
מרכז שפיים וגעש הוא מרכז קניות פתוח מפורסם באזור מישור החוף ואפשר לתפוס ממנו טרמפ בקלות לכיוון תל אביב עד נתניה.
Two backpackers hitched from this spot to "Golani junction" in 10 minutes wait. שני תרמילאים תפסו מכאן טרמפ לצומת גולני אחרי המתנה של עשר דקות. בהצלחה.

"Trempyada" (a hitchikers bus stop) on both ways going north to the "high galil" and "the golan hights" and south to The gallile sea.
בצומת ראש פינה יש יופי של טרמפיאדה ואפשר לעצור טרמפים לכיוון דרום וצפון.

I once took 3 teenagers from here to haifa. they waited around 15 min.
לקחתי מכאן שלושה בני נוער חובשי כיפה לחיפה. הם חיכו כרבע שעה
Puriya junction is the best place to catch a ride from the Gaillile sea towards Haifa

bus stop on the drive up of highway 2
good for being dropped off and going on to Tel Aviv

From sde boker to Beersheva or Mitzpe-Ramon a very safe location to hitchhike.
 better at day.

HaShalom junction (next to the haShalom rail station) is a good place to hitch hike if you're north-bound. At the rail station, walk east until you arrive to the Ayalon highway northbound traffic lights. The road is accessible and very wide - Favorable spots are a factory front with a lot of parking space, and a small hitch hiking station further down the lane, even though you are more likely to be seen next to the factory. Most cars either travel to the Kfar Saba-Raanana area via hwy #4, or all

Got a good ride nearly to Haifa, but there are maybe better spots closer to the centre.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Tel_Aviv

Good spot for a ride south.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Haifa
Low traffic but that means cars might stop in the middle of the road for you. Got a ride all the way to the Golani junction. Better here than in the main road imo, people drive there pretty fast

Spot near the Nova Festival Memorial Site. Cars are rather fast and not that much space for cars to stop but a car stopped after 2min with a ride to Tel Aviv. Alternatively walk 1km back to Re'im for proper spots with bus stops.
Bus stop, shade, enough space and good visibility.
Bus stop with plenty of space to stop and good visibility. No shade. Free campsite nearby.
Bus stop but no shade. Not much traffic and ppl seem to be less willing to stop. (next to the border and mainly only military bases around
Good spot with bus stop. Not much traffic.
Easy to get rides but there is not much traffic and most cars only go to military bases in the desert. General road 90 is a better option but it is a beautiful ride along the border
Got a ride to Kfar giladi in few minutes time
A bearded backpakper got a great ride with a great person to the kibutzes of the norhests part of Israel after 5 minutes wait. Good times!
One bearded backpacker got a ride from here to Golani Junction (see spot about 30km northeast) in 10 minutes casual wait.
I hitched twice from here. Once to Jerusalem (took me 15 minutes). The other to north of the country with a friend. Took us 5 minutes.

Two backpackers hitched from the trempyada outside atlit to Yakum (50-60KM) on Shabat after a 25 minutes wait.
בשבת שלפני פסח שני תרמילאים תפסו בטרמפיאדה מחוץ לעתלית טרמפ ליקום אחרי המתנה של 25 דקות
No bus stop but big enough shoulder to stop.

If you are going south it is better to go down to the gas station and to talk to people or stand on the other side of the road.. Very slow place. If you have to spend the night here, you can go by foot to the village north of here and find a place to sleep there (Or just sleep behind the gas station)
watch out, no bus stop at this junction!! (Jan 2013)

Here on Shabbat(Saturday late afternoon, mid August), direction airport. There is some space for car to pull by, I walked past the traffic light and onto the entrance of highway. There just 5 minutes, some tourists picked me up to the airport. Quite a decent spot I’d say!
not the best place ever. few place to stop, cars are coming in waves. and they are going to several directions, at least 4 cars stopped till we got the right way.

Despite was Shabbat i arrived easily in Jerusalem! After 5 minutes a car stopped but he wasn't going on my direction! The second car wasn't going to Jerusalem but the woman driver left me on a national road and it worked very well was very easy to arrive in Jerusalem! I really recommend it, the spot is good there s enough space for car to stop!

I was here but no cars stopped so I went up to the La Gardia 
There are no place to stop and the bushes grow very big so the cars won't see you
Good spot, bus stop, but cars are way too fast - we waited 45 minutes and we got a lift only to Ein Bokek.
An important notice: There's constraction going in the hotel-area of the dead sea, so This is the last Trempiyada until the salt-robbing plant.
Bus station-Hitching spot (Trempiyada) going south
Coming from the Highway 6 this is a decent spot to hitchhike directly on Route 65 eastwards, since cars a slower than usual, due to a trafficlight.
Don't go with the taxis (Bet She'an for 40-60 NIS). We went up the hill and got a lift from locals in some 15 minutes.
Border crossing direction Israel.
We got a ride from here to Dimona in 10 minutes waiting with two nice shippers.
Bus station-Hitching spot (Trempiyada) in front of the terrible Sea-killer plant. Going south.
Its a good place to take a ride but many cars go just 10-15 KM farther.
Bus station - Hitching spot (TrempiYada) going south.
I get a ride here in 5 minutes (going to Sde Boker, with a sing in hebrew)

I was going to the Negev. Looks like a good spot, but I did not get a ride after over 1 hour waiting (unusual in Israel). I started walking down the road - after 10-15 minutes walk, you are outside of town on the desert road, and anywhere there is a good spot.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Be'er_Sheva
it is close to the border but there is no traffic. i car took me 2 km, then i took a regular bus to the border for 5 NIS. it's walking distance, depends on the weather and your condition.
it's a little bit difficult place to hh, despite of there is a bus stop. i used a sign to Jerusalem and i got a ride after 30 min.
From "Merkaz" train station or its called also Masof 2000 ... Giong south.

Hard place to get to, but two hikers took a ride from here to kiryr shmona (northest city in Israel), about 50K in half an hour wait.
לא מקום אידאלי לתפוס בו טרמפ אבל בחור נחמד לקח אותנו לקריית שמונה ואפילו הזמין אותנו לפלאפל.
On the side of the road there is a "belly" where cars can stop towards road 90 (The road from Golan hights until Eilat).
Cars go fast along this road - it looked good in theory, but it took 1 hour to get a ride.
In theory a good spot for Tel Aviv, but it wasn't our day. As ever, a cheap taxi will offer you a lifeline.

Turned down a few rides as most people went to Tel Aviv and we needed to get to Tiberias. This woman picked us up then dropped us in the middle of the highway before the exit to Tiberias. Lots of traffic at decent speeds, but expect to wait as it's right across the central bus station
One bearded hitchhiker gop a ride from here to Yoquneam in 30 min wait.
Doesn't seem like a good place to hitch, but this nice lady took us (two travelers) on saturday to tlv with under 5 minutes waiting time!
If you want to go north, but your ride continues to Tel Aviv, get dropped of here! Most driver will still go to Tel Aviv, but will go directly to Haifa. Only possible in one direction.
Even tough this seems like a bad place to stop, we got a pickup north to Tel-Aviv after just 30 minutes of waiting.
There is no official place to stop in this place

Got stuck here twice fro five hours had to catch a cab in the end ... better to get back up to Ein Karem and get a ride from there its just a 10 min walk.
Good luck.
THIS IS NOT THE "ARAVA JUNCTION"! I pressed here by mistake :) next hitchhiker that goes here can fill in the info.
"Ha-Arava junction" going south. There is a bus-hitchhiking spot (Trempiyada) and also a gas station here.
it looked like a nice place but nobody stopped.
